intro: Campanula camtschatica, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Eastern Siberia and the Russian Far East. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Campanula camtschatica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its striking appearance.
